subject: Re: [junit] Test organization in J++
msgSnippet: ... If you don t need the tests to be in the same package as the production code -- and not everyone agrees on that as a general practice -- then when testing
messageBody:
Chris Morris wrote:

> I'm experimenting with test class organization in conjunction with J++.
>
> I'd like to do:
>
> src
> com
> xyz
> SomeClass.java
> test
> com
> xyz
> SomeClassTest.java
>
>
> ... in order to keep the compiled test files out of the main project,
> but in J++ it seems that I can only navigate code that lives under the
> project file, but this same code is also compiled into the project as
> well, so it appears to be a catch-22.
>
> Nevertheless, I'm a newbie with the J++ IDE and its ins and outs, anyone
> have any tips?

If you don't need the tests to be in the same package as the production
code -- and not everyone agrees on that as a general practice -- then
when testing a behavior mostly in a class in package x.y.z, put that
test in a package called x.y.z.test.
